name: (2Z)-[(4-chlorophenyl)hydrazono][4-(4-methylphenyl)-1,3-thiazol-2-yl]ethanenitrile
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1043
Reason: 1. The basic unit for comparison is 1,3-thiazole, which has a melting point of around 100 degrees Celsius. 2. The chlorine atom introduces a strong withdrawing group, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +50 degrees Celsius. The phenyl group contributes to the melting point due to its ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. Each phenyl group may contribute around +30 to +50 degrees Celsius. The methyl group introduces a small increase due to its ability to participate in hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +5 degrees Celsius. The hydrazono group introduces additional rigidity, contributing approximately +20 degrees Celsius. The thiazole ring introduces additional rigidity, contributing approximately +20 degrees Celsius.
